pullRequest.title: XRDDEV-947
pullRequest.bodyText:
Implement API for alerts that warns about:

issues with global conf and soft token
ongoing backup/restore processes running.

commit.message:
XRDDEV-947 API for alerts

- Implement API for alerts about issues with global conf and soft token.
XRDDEV-947 Always return current status regardless of alertsEnabled value

XRDDEV-947 Refactor alerts endpoint

- Remove ignore_alerts property.
- Add current_time and backup_restore_running_since properties.

XRDDEV-1007 API to reset warnings

- Add API to reset the backup restoration in progress warning.
- Update tests.

nodes.bodyText: I don't think that the static keyword adds any benefits here or the getter, setter and reset methods below. It works fine (possibly even faster) but beans are singleton by nature so there should be no need for static members. It causes some troubles testing (not being able to mock) and @Transactional and some other Spring AOP features do not actually support static methods. So just to be on the safe side I would remove the static keywords from the class members.

Should this also check whether the Security Server has been initialized yet? That is of course still in review but since the old implementation checks the init status, maybe it should be added here also to avoid throwing "false" exceptions. If it is something that is wanted, maybe we should create a new ticket so it does not get forgotten.

The old implementation does not stop execution if the soft token is not found. However a RuntimeException here makes sense if the token has been properly initialized but nevertheless is not found. Adding the init check in the getAlerts method would actually help in this situation too
Nothing major but would follow other conventions if this test was in org.niis.xroad.restapi.controller package instead of org.niis.xroad.restapi.openapi

commit.message:
XRDDEV-947 Updates based on review comments

- Move NotificationsApiControllerTest to controller package.
- Make backupRestoreRunningSince variable and methods accessing it non-static.
